title: need a typeface to compliment helvetica
content: im doing a series of typographic posters and need to find an appropriate typeface for the body text the header is helvetica and i need some variation, what would be good, all the posters are about films, books or songs
author: gemnastar37

comments.content: That's sort of like asking for a color that goes well with beige. Most anything will do.
but what would be ideal? my mind is drawing a serious blank
what mood / sensibility / concept is each poster trying to communicate?
I'm thinkin' [Vegur](http://web.archive.org/web/20130317110649/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/Vegur). Maybe it's just my mood.

<cite>...Clarendon.</cite>

Robert Bringhurst recommends _Haas_ Clarendon, rather.

You will find a match in Linotype Clarendon (designed by Hermann Eidenbenz in 1953), but better still is David Berlow's [Belizio](http://web.archive.org/web/20130317110649/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Belizio).

I'd never use Vegur or any humanist sans next to Helvetica.  
Mostely choosing something quite different is a better idea.

[http://www.fontshop.com/search/?&q=helserif&x=0&y=0&sample\_text=Find%20y...](http://web.archive.org/web/20130317110649/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?&q=helserif&x=0&y=0&sample_text=Find%20your%20feet.&sample_size=48&update=0 "http://www.fontshop.com/search/?&q=helserif&x=0&y=0&sample\_text=Find%20your%20feet.&sample\_size=48&update=0")

I am looking for a nice face to match with Helvetica to. Finding it tough but i quite like this idea, could work well for body text. The price ain't to shabby either.

Hope this is useful.
